description:
From Middle English auctorisen, from Old French auctorisier, from Medieval Latin auctorizare, from Latin auctor.
See author about the orthography with <h>. Doublet of octroy.

verbs.description: authorize (third-person singular simple present authorizes, present participle authorizing, simple past and past participle authorized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To grant (someone) the permission or power necessary to do (something); to permit; to sanction or consent to.
examples: The General Assembly authorized the Council to take up the matter.
